definition: one/1/single/a (article)/as soon as/entire/whole/all/throughout/"one" radical in Chinese characters (Kangxi radical 1)/also pr. [yao1] for greater clarity when spelling out numbers digit by digit
to take it up a notch/to bring it up a level

sentences.english: That situation has often been compared to peeling the skins of an onion.
sentences.chinese: 这正如一层一层剥下洋葱皮。

sentences.english: That situation has often been compared to peeling the skins of an onion.
sentences.chinese: 这正如一层一层剥下洋葱皮。

sentences.english: There was a thin curst of dirt around the bath.
sentences.chinese: 水面上浮有一层薄薄的油。

sentences.english: I am not a good painter but I like to daub.
sentences.chinese: 下一道手续是在墙面上涂抹一层沙浆。

sentences.english: I use a solid stick over it for extra coverage.
sentences.chinese: 我同时还使用棒状额外再涂一层。

sentences.english: Fromthat day on, we were ever so faithful to Jesus.
sentences.chinese: 从那天起，我们对耶稣无比的忠诚又更深一层了。

sentences.english: Sauna center on the basement floor, beauty center.
sentences.chinese: 位于酒店地下一层的洗浴中心，美容美发中心。

sentences.english: It is so thin that you secretly smile at it and I feel ashamed.
sentences.chinese: 这一层薄纱，薄得使你暗暗地窃笑，我感到害羞。

sentences.english: The pilots looked outside the cockpit window and saw that the plane was coated by a thin cloud.
sentences.chinese: 驾驶员注视座舱窗外，看到飞机被一层薄云覆盖。

sentences.english: When you cohabit , it adds a sense of commitment to a relationship that is going nowhere.
sentences.chinese: 同居让一段难以有进展的关系又多了一层约束力。

sentences.english: The surface of the sea seems to be an invisible membrane between the water and the air.
sentences.chinese: 海的表面似乎是隔在水与空气间的一层看不见的薄膜。

sentences.english: Underneath their fur, polar bears have an additional 10-cm-layer of fat, called blubber.
sentences.chinese: 在毛皮的下面还有一层十厘米厚的脂肪，名为鲸脂。

sentences.english: There are various banks at the 1st floor, Jing An Center, south east of CIEC.
sentences.chinese: 位于国展中心西南方向的静安中心一层内有多家银行。

sentences.english: In Shansi province two storey and one and a half storey houses are typical.
sentences.chinese: 在山西省，典型的住房是两层和一层半。

sentences.english: To add depth to the splatter, first place one normal splatter on one layer.
sentences.chinese: 要添加深入到飞溅，首先是一个正常的飞溅的一层。

sentences.english: We were on the ground floor and when I came to I was lying under a pile of rubble.
sentences.chinese: 我们当时都在第一层，我发现我躺在一堆碎石块下。

definition: to spread/to display/to set up/(old) holder for door-knocker
plank bed/place to sleep/shop/store/(old) relay station
top floor/the top of a building
